item.title: Astronomers Have Discovered A New Moon In Our Solar System
item.description:
Astronomers Have Discovered A New Moon In Our Solar System

"Moon over Makemake" sounds like a novel or painting, but actually represents a NASA announcement of the discovery of a companion for the third largest (and second brightest) dwarf planet in the Kuiper Belt. The announcement strengthens the hypothesis that most dwarf planets have moons, while also making Pluto look somewhat less special.

item.title: Evidence Suggests Mars Once Had Much More Oxygen Than It Does Now
item.description:
Evidence Suggests Mars Once Had Much More Oxygen Than It Does Now

Speaking at the European Geophysical Union in Vienna this week, a team of scientists said they have found strong evidence for Mars once having a lot more oxygen than it does currently. The results, if confirmed, would have important implications for the potential ancient habitability of Mars.
